p.s: In the excerpt of the play The Merchant of Venice, written by William ShakespearWilliam Shakespeare, Shylock, the antagonist of the story, finds himself in a perculiarpeculiar situation.
Between the happiness of his enemy's downfall and the sadness of loosinglosing his daughter and his money.
Prior to this excerpt we learn of a bond that a Christian named Antonio made for his friend Bassanio.
Shylock and Antonio are enemies since Antonio has treated Shylock very poorly.
Antonio was asked to lend 3000 ducats to Bassanio, to wichwhich he asked to be allowed to cut one ponud of flesh out above Antonio's heart if they don't pay the money back within three months.
Also prior to this exerptexcerpt Jessica, Shylock's daughter, ran away with a Christian and a lot of money.
Shylock sent a good friend named Tubal to look for his daughter.
In this excerpt Tubal has just returned from searching for Jessica in Genoa.
He tells the eagerly awaiting Shylock that he was unable to find Jessica and that she spent lots of money within one night.
Shylock gets mad and talks about how he spends so much money on finding her, he says that she wishes she was dead, for then he would not have to search for her anymore.
This makes him very pessimistic and sad.
But then Tubal tells Shylock that he also heard that Antonio won't be able to pay the money back and Shylock is suddenly happy again, thanking good god that Antonio's ship got cast away.
Shylock gets carried away by his happiness and starts making plans on how to torture Antonio when he's back, since he finally feels like he is able to get revenge.
Tubal then switched topics back to Jessica, exchanged a ring of her death mother for a monkey.
Afterwards Tubal then restates taht Antonio is bankrupt and Shylock's mood lightens up again.
He tells Tubal to hire an officer for him so that he can execute the bond.
So that he can finally have his revenge.
